meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unfit.
meanings.sent1: Her unfitnesses for the job were evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: The unfitnesses of the old equipment led to frequent breakdowns.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unfitnesses for dancing, he always tried to impress at parties.
meanings.sent4: The unfitnesses of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.
meanings.sent5: The unfitnesses of the bridge's structure posed a danger to all who crossed.

meanings.sent1: The unfitnesses of the candidate were clear during the interview.
meanings.sent2: His unfitnesses for the role became apparent after a few weeks.
meanings.sent3: The unfitnesses of the clown to juggle added humor to the show.
meanings.sent4: The unfitnesses of the boat captain nearly led to a disaster at sea.
meanings.sent5: Her unfitnesses for public speaking made her nervous before every presentation.

meanings.definition: Inability to meet the required standards.
meanings.sent1: The unfitnesses of the product resulted in many returns.
meanings.sent2: His unfitnesses for the test caused him to study harder.
meanings.sent3: The unfitnesses of the recipe made it taste like a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The unfitnesses of the car's brakes put everyone in danger.
meanings.sent5: Her unfitnesses for the role were evident in every performance.
